Package gameTools

Class CollisionDetection

java.lang.Object
gameTools.CollisionDetection
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
public class CollisionDetection extends Object implements GameVariables

Stores the two collision functions we use for our game, MazeRunner. We put these files in a separate class and made them static, so other classes can use them without needed their own methods or having to create a CollisionDetection object.

Since:
March 26, 2024
Author:
Nick Clouse

  • Method Details

    • fullCollision

      public static boolean fullCollision(int[] xCoordsOne, int[] yCoordsOne, int[] xCoordsTwo, int[] yCoordsTwo)
      Checks for collision between the given coordinates, which represent a square. The coordinates are ordered top left, top right, bottom right, bottom left. Compares the first set to second set, this checks if there is a full collision, which is when all of x/yCoordsTwo are inside of x/yCoords one.
      Parameters:
      xCoordsOne - The first set of x coordinates.
      yCoordsOne - The first set of y coordinates.
      xCoordsTwo - The second set of x coordinates.
      yCoordsTwo - The second set of y coordinates.
      Returns:
      true if there is a full collision.

    • getCollision

      public static boolean getCollision(int[] xCoordsOne, int[] yCoordsOne, int[] xCoordsTwo, int[] yCoordsTwo)
      Checks for collision between the given coordinates, which represent a square. The coordinates are ordered top left, top right, bottom right, bottom left.
      Parameters:
      xCoordsOne - The first set of x coordinates.
      yCoordsOne - The first set of y coordinates.
      xCoordsTwo - The second set of x coordinates.
      yCoordsTwo - The second set of y coordinates.
      Returns:
      true if there is a collision.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method, used for testing.

      args - Arguments passed
